episode_event_salon_pasiosalon_date_ch02:
[Name:PlayerNickname ] was asked to
make a guest appearance at an event Lear
was hosting.

[EN:Gen Ref="255" M="He" F="She" ] paid Piers a visit to learn ways to work
a crowd aside from Pokémon battling...
I see...

So you wanna use this opportunity to try
something new.

I don’t mind givin’ advice, but...why come
to me?

(Answer that you enjoy Piers’s
concerts.)
Can’t say I mind a compliment.
(Answer that Marnie suggested it.)
Marnie recommended me? Makes sense.

But just as a warning, before I teach you
anything...

If your desire to perform comes from the
heart, I won’t stop you...

but if you’re only doin’ it to work the crowd,
you should stop now.

If you try to blag your way through,
the audience’ll see right through you.

Are people moved by passionless words and
actions? No, right?
(Respect his professionalism.)

That gleam in your eye is the real deal.
No need to worry, then.

(Tell him that if you do it, you’ll take
it seriously.)

You’re just like Marnie—you stop listenin’ to
reason once you’ve got your mind made up.
Right, then. I’ll teach you a thing or two.

Well, since I’ve talked a big game, it’s only
right to set an example.

Drop by the town square later.
There’s something I wanna show ya.

In the town square,
[Name:PlayerNickname ] spotted Piers
holding a surprise concert.

I put my whole heart into that song.
What did you think?
(Tell him it fired you up.)
Great. That’s what performing is about.

(Tell him it made you want to try
your best.)

So it moved you. That’s what I was
hopin’ for.
Expressin’ your feelings honestly...
It’s essential for reachin’ people’s hearts.

Whenever I have feelings I want to get
across, I sing them to music.

My lyrics and music might’ve changed since
my days in Galar, though.
I never thought I’d sing such upbeat songs.

I guess that only started after I met you
and the others on Pasio,
[Name:PlayerNickname ].

Oh, I don’t want you to get the wrong idea,
so let me elaborate.

If you stay true to your feelings, how you
express yourself can change over time.

But on the flip side, you can also appeal to
an audience by sticking to your core beliefs.

During Pokémon battles, I stay true to myself
and what I believe in, and that strikes a
chord with my audience.

I show them that even without Dynamaxing,
you can have a good battle.

Shouting out exactly who you are is also a
fine way to perform.
What’s vital is how strong your feelings are.

(Tell him you’ll keep working on what
you enjoy.)
All right. I’ll be looking forward to it.
(Ask him if that’s the rocker lifestyle.)

Without a doubt. Never wavering in my
beliefs is how I express myself—and who
I am as a person.
That’s all I can teach you for now.

Your honest feelings and Pokémon battles’ll
rouse the crowd, for sure.

You’ll do fine—that’s a guarantee from me,
Piers the Melancholy!
